column4: ok I'm tryin to get acroread to work, would /usr/bin/Acrobat5/bin count as the install directory?
if you're installing it outside of the packaging system, use /usr/local as the stem name then make symlinks of the executable to /usr/local/bin
well, since that is *within* the packaging system disregard my /usr/local advice. It should have put acroread somewhere in your path.
well, add multiverse and you can install a lot of non-free stuff without leaving ubuntu repos.
